job description:
Are you excited about exploring hidden relations in data? Do you have a passion for training a machine to make good decisions? Northern Trust, a leader in the banking industry is looking for a Data Scientist to join the Engineering Monitoring Group’s Data Analytics Team. In this role you will be involved with using tools and technology to implement solutions that enable software system to recommend or automate data-driven decisions. This role will require the ability to perform both exploratory Data Science work as well as develop explanatory solutions and implement reactive autonomous systems.

Responsibilities:

This role will work on the Infrastructure Data Analytics Team to create solutions which increase stability, create clarity, and reduce the operational costs of highly visible applications and software systems for Northern Trust. These solutions require the use of Big Data tools such as Splunk, ELK, and Hadoop, as well as integration with tools such as Service-Now. In order to succeed at this role a candidate should have the ability to understand modern techniques for data analysis which include but are not limited to:

Understanding Of:
  • Infrastructure components (e.g. VMs, Servers, Routers, Network Switches, Accelerators, etc.)
  • Proven Diagnosis and Tuning experience, with Applications or Infrastructure Components
  • Automation Tools and Techniques
Exposure to / Plus:
  • Data Science tools (e.g. Splunk ITSI, Splunk Machine Learning Toolkit, Splunk Visualiztion, etc.)
  • Data transformation and Conformal Mapping/Decomposition
  • Statistical Analysis with R, Matlab, Octave, or other scripting language
  • 7+ years of experience.
  • Proven quick self-directed learner
  • BA or BS in Math, CS, Engineering, Physics, or a Quantitative Science
  • 5+ years in an IT Infrastructure Engineering Role
  • Knowledge of a Statistics and how to apply it to Infrastructure Data Ability to code in an Object Oriented Language such as Java or C++
  • Ability to code in a Functional Paradigm such as Scala or Go Lang
  • Ability to code in a scripting language such as SPL, Python or others
  • Exposure to the areas of AI, ML, and Data Science with an ability and desire to grow.
  • Good communication skills
  • Team Player

We burnished our reputation as a global leader delivering innovative investment management, asset and fund administration, fiduciary and banking solutions enabled by sophisticated, leading technology. And through it all, we continually laid a solid, forward-looking foundation on which future generations can continue growing and achieving greater.
